ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: We learned about the history of the French prose poem and practiced close readings of specific poems.
Literary analysis of French; greater understanding of French poetry; engagement with idea of genre
I learned about the history of the prose poem in French, as well as how to analyze individual poems in a variety of ways.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course is very much a survey of the genre of the prose poem in French literature over the past couple centuries. There's a lot of reading involved (one book per week), and each week in class you discuss the previous week's readings. I really liked our discussions, but the reading was sometimes a lot.

The material is so interesting and conversations were so rich! Such a great class! This course could be improved with even more background history/etymology/those sorts of things--more context for the authors and their work.

Professor Connolly is extremely kind and understanding, the readings are wonderful and discussions fascinating.
I wish female poets were included. Also, there was not enough class time per week (wish there were two classes a week at least) and I wish there was more guidance in literary analysis for the short essays. Readings were often very long too.

All strengths!! All of the readings were great, the feedback on assignments was very helpful, and the tutors (Normaliens) were brilliant as well. Sometimes there was just more reading than I could handle in a week, but that was fine I did what I could.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If you're interested in French literature, then yes! However, if you're just looking to fulfill a language requirement in L5 French and have never taken a French literature course before, I would recommend starting at a lower level L5 course.
Absolutely !! I loved this class, and Professor Connolly is always so kind and gives great feedback.
Yes! It is a brilliant course to take to challenge your notions of genre and expand your understanding of French poetry.
Yes! Prof. Connolly is a wonderful teacher, and the poems are great, and very varied.
